ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies an input data set.

[Syntax: GOUT=graphics-catalog] 
      
Specifies a catalog for saving graphical output.

[Syntax: NAMELEN=n] 
      
Specifies the length of effect names in tables and output data sets to be n characters long, 
where n is a value between 20 and 200 characters. The default length is 20 characters.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CONFIDENCE=number] 
          
Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. 
The default value is 0.95.

[Syntax: CONVERGE=value] 
          
Sets the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: CONVH=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.
Requests parameter correlation matrix.
Requests parameter covariance matrix.
Specifies method of estimating distribution parameters.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The probability axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The lifetime axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Uses the fit from the preceding MODEL statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Weibayes method, where number is the confidence coefficient for the Weibayes fit and is between 0 and 1.  The default value is 0.95.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.
Requests iteration history for the Turnbull algorithm.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution percentiles.

[Syntax: LOCATION=number < LINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

[Syntax: MAXIT=n] 
          
Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: MAXITEREM= | MAXITEM=number1 <,number2>] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed for the Turnbull algorithm. Iteration history 
will be displayed in increments of n2 if requested with the ITPRINTEM option.
Suppresses computation of percentiles for standard list of percentage points.
Suppresses setting small interval probabilities to zero in the Turnbull algorithm.

[Syntax: PCTLIST=value-list] 
          
Specifies the list of percentages for which to compute percentile estimates; value-list must be a 
list of values separated by blanks or commas. Each value in the list must be between 0 and 100.
Specifies the plotting position type.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Median ranks

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies that a table of the cumulative probabilities plotted on the probability plot be displayed.

[Syntax: PREDICT(number)] 
        
Requests predicted counts for exposure number for Poisson or sample size number for binomial.
Prints intervals and associated probabilities for the Turnbull algorithm.

[Syntax: PSTABLE=number] 
          
Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units 
failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed 
units entering each interval.

[Syntax: SCALE=number < SCINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of scale parameter.

[Syntax: SHAPE=number < SHINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of shape parameter.

[Syntax: SINGULAR=number] 
          
Specifies singularity criterion for matrix inversion.

[Syntax: SURVTIME=number-list] 
        
Requests that the survival function, cumulative distribution function, and confidence limits 
be computed for values in number-list

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=number] 
        
Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

[Syntax: TOLERANCE(number)] 
        
Requests exposure for Poisson or sample size for binomial to estimate Poisson rate or binomial 
probability within number with probability given by the CONFIDENCE= option.

[Syntax: TOLLIKE=number] 
          
Specifies criterion for convergence in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁸.

[Syntax: TOLPROB=number] 
          
Specifies criterion for setting interval probability to zero in the Turnbull algorithm. 
Default is 10⁻⁶.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY variable-names ;
      
You can specify a BY statement with PROC RELIABILITY to obtain separate analyses on observations 
in groups defined by the BY variables. When a BY statement appears, the procedure expects the input 
data set to be sorted in order of the BY variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Binomial distribution
[Exponential distribution
Extreme value distribution
Generalized gamma distribution
Logistic distribution
Loglogistic distribution
Lognormal (base e) distribution
Lognormal (base 10) distribution
Normal distribution
Poisson distribution
Weibull distribution
Specifies a LEGEND statement for individual mode fit lines.
Suppresses legend for individual mode fit lines.
Plots individual failure distribution lines on probability plot.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FREQ variable-name ;
      
The FREQ statement specifies a variable that provides frequency counts for each observation in the 
input data set. If n is the value of the FREQ variable for an observation, then that observation is 
weighted by n.

Syntax: INSET keyword-list< / options >; 
      
The box or table of summary information produced on plots made with the PROBPLOT or MCFPLOT statement 
is called an inset. You can use the INSET statement to customize the information that is printed in the 
inset box and the appearance of the inset box.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CFILL=color | BLANK] 
          
Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not 
specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents 
items from showing through the inset.
Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

[Syntax: CFILLH=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header background. By default, if you do not specify a CFILLH= color, 
the CFILL= color is used.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the frame. By default, the frame is the same color as the axis of the plot.

[Syntax: CHEADER=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the header text. By default, if you do not specify a CHEADER= color, the 
CTEXT= color is used.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color of the text. By default, the inset text color is the same as the other text 
on the plot.

[Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located in the 
interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the plot if the 
inset is located in the exterior of the plot.

[Syntax: HEADER= 'string'] 
          
Specifies the header or box title text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of the text in screen percent units.
Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

[Syntax: POS=value <DATA | PERCENT>] 
          
Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, a margin keyword, 
or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in axis percent units or axis data units.

Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates with the 
POSITION= option.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Bottom left

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Sample size
Number of failures for probability plots
Number of events or repairs for MCF plots
Number of events or repairs in the first group for MCF difference plots
Number of units or systems for MCF plots
Number of units or systems in the first group for MCF difference plots
Number of units or systems in the second group for MCF difference plots
Confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals or for the Weibayes fit
Method used to estimate distribution parameters for probability plots
R² for least squares distribution fit to probability plots

[Syntax: INITIAL=number list] 
          
Specifies initial values for log-scale regression parameters other than the intercept term.

[Syntax: INTERCEPT=number < INTINIT >] 
          
Specifies initial or fixed value of the intercept parameter, depending on whether INTINIT is present.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
          
Specifies the output data set.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: 
<label:> MCFPLOT variable cost/censor-variable(values) <=(group-variables)> < / options >; 
<label:> MCFPLOT ( <INTERVAL=> variable1 variable2 <RECURRENCES=> variable3 <CENSOR=> variable4 ) 
  <=(group-variables)> < / options >; 

Creates a plot of the mean cumulative function. You can specify any number of MCFPLOT statements
after a PROC RELIABILITY statement. Each MCFPLOT statement creates a separate MCF plot and
associated analysis.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications 
in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

Syntax: CCENSOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling the censor plot area. The default is the first color in the device 
color list.
Plots censored data as frequency counts (rounding for noninteger frequency) rather than as individual points.

[Syntax: CENCOLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the censor symbol. The default is the first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CENSYMBOL=symbol | (symbol list) ] 
          
Specifies symbols for censored values. The symbol is one of the symbol names (plus, star, square, 
diamond, triangle, hash, paw, point, dot, and circle) or a letter (A–Z).

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. This area is not shaded 
by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Color for filling frame for row labels.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Color for filling frame for column labels.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in 
the device color list.

[Syntax: CONFIDENCE=number] 
          
Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. 
The default value is 0.95.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the 
device color list.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION=’string’] 
          
Description for graphics catalog member.

Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for 
axis labels in an AXIS statement.

[Syntax: HAXIS=value1 to value2<by value3>] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the horizontal axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, 
and value1 must be less than value2.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

[Syntax: HLOWER=value] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower 
lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset for the horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: HUPPER=value] 
          
Specifies value as the upper lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower 
axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HREF=value-list] 
          
Specifies reference lines perpendicular to horizontal axis

[Syntax: HREFLABELS=’label1’ ...’labeln’] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option.
Specifies the vertical position of labels for HREF= lines.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests a border around probability plots.

Requests variance estimates of the MCF using the Nelson estimator under an independent increments 
assumption.

[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for text inside framed areas.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies height of text inside framed areas.
Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a straight line or step function.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a straight line function.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Requests that symbols in an MCF plot be connected with a step function.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance between tiles.

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies a line style for all grid lines; linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

[Syntax: LHREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.
Requests that confidence intervals be computed based on the asymptotic normality of log(MCF).
Requests log scales on both axes.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: MCFLEGEND=legend-statement-name | NONE] 
          
Identifies legend statement to specify legend for overlaid MCF plots.
Adds a minor grid for log axes.
Requests that missing values of first GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.
Requests that missing values of second GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies number of columns plotted on a page.

[Syntax: NAME=’string’] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, in graphics catalog.

[Syntax: NHTICK=number] 
          
Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for horizontal axis.
Suppresses the plotting of censored data points.
Suppresses the default percentile confidence bands on the probability plot.
Suppresses the frame around plotting areas.
Suppresses grid lines.
Suppresses label for horizontal axis.
Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for horizontal axis.
Suppresses inset.
Suppresses MCF variance computation.
Alternate method of specifying variance calculation. Includes INDINC and VARMETHOD2 options.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Lawless-Nadeau method

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests that the method of Lawless and Nadeau (1995) be used to compute variance estimates of the MCF.
Suppresses label for vertical axis.
Suppresses tick marks and tick mark labels for vertical axis.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies number of rows plotted on a page.
Specifies display order for values of the first GROUP= variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  depends on your operating environment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Specifies display order for values of the second GROUP= variable.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  depends on your operating environment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests overlaid plots for group variables.

[Syntax: PLOTSYMBOL=symbol | (symbol list)] 
          
Symbols representing events in an MCF plot.

[Syntax: PLOTCOLOR=color | (color list)] 
          
Colors of symbols representing events in an MCF plot.
Vertically strings out characters in labels for vertical axis.

[Syntax: VAXIS=value1 to value2<by value3>] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the vertical axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, 
and value1 must be less than value2.

[Syntax: VAXISLABEL=`string'] 
          
Specifies a label for the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VLOWER=number] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the vertical axis scale.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Length of offset at upper end of vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREF <(INTERSECT)>=value-list] 
          
Requests reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS=’label1’ ...’labeln’] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal 
the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: VUPPER=number] 
          
Specifies the upper limit on the vertical axis scale.

[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: CONFIDENCE=number] 
          
Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. 
The default value is 0.95.

[Syntax: CONVERGE=value] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: CONVH=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.
Requests parameter correlation matrix.
Requests parameter covariance matrix.
Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.

[Syntax: LOCATION=number < LINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

[Syntax: MAXIT=n] 
          
Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: OBSTATS | OBSTATS(statistics)

OBSTATS
requests a table containing the XBETA, SURV, SRESID, and ADJRESID statistics. The table also 
contains the dependent and independent variables in the model.

OBSTATS(statistics)
requests a table containing the model variables and the statistics specified below:
          
  CENSOR is an indicator variable equal to 1 if an observation is censored, and 0 otherwise 

  QUANTILES | QUANTILE | Q=number-list 
  specifies distribution quantiles for each number in number list for each observation. The numbers must be between 0 and 1. Estimated quantile standard errors, and upper and lower confidence limits are also tabulated. 

  XBETA is the linear predictor 

  SURVIVAL | SURV 
  is the fitted survival function, evaluated at the value of the dependent variable 

  RESID is the raw residual
  SRESID is the standardized residual 
  GRESID is the modified Cox-Snell residual 
  DRESID is the deviance residual 

  ADJRESID 
  is the adjusted standardized residuals. These are adjusted for right-censored observations by 
  adding the median of the lifetime greater than the right-censored values to the residuals. 

  RESIDADJ=number 
  specifies adjustment to be added to Cox-Snell residual for right-censored data values. The 
  default is log(2) = 0.693. 

  RESIDALPHA | RALPHA=number 
  specifies number x 100% percentile residual lifetime used to adjust right-censored standardized 
  residuals. The number must be between 0 and 1. The default value is 0.5, corresponding to the median. 

  CONTROL=variable specifies a control variable in the input data set.
Specifies sort order for values of the classification variables in the effect-list.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  depends on your operating environment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PSTABLE=number] 
          
Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units 
failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed 
units entering each interval.
Specifies type of relationship between independent and dependent variables.

[Syntax: SHAPE=number < SHINIT >]

[Syntax: SINGULAR=number]

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=number] 
          
Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications

Syntax: CCENSOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling the censor plot area. The default is the first color in the device color list.
Plots censored data as frequency counts (rounding for noninteger frequency) rather than as individual points.

[Syntax: CENCOLOR=color]

[Syntax: CFIT=color]

first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. This area is not shaded by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color]

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in 
the device color list.

[Syntax: CONFIDENCE=number] 
          
Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. 
The default value is 0.95.

[Syntax: CONVERGE=value] 
          
Sets the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: CONVH=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the 
device color list.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION=’string’] 
          
Description for graphics catalog member.
Specifies method of estimating distribution parameters.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The probability axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The lifetime axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Uses the fit from the preceding MODEL statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Syntax: WEIBAYES<(CONFIDENCE=number)>                                      Weibayes method, where number is the confidence coefficient for the Weibayes fit and is between 0 and 1.  The default value is 0.95.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis 
labels in an AXIS statement.
Computes and draws confidence limits for the predicted probabilities in the horizontal direction.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

[Syntax: HLOWER=value] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower 
lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset for the horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: HUPPER=value] 
          
Specifies value as the upper lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower 
axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HREF <(INTERSECT)> =value-list] 
          
Requests reference lines perpendicular to horizontal axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second 
reference line perpendicular to the vertical axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same 
point as the horizontal axis reference line. If a horizontal axis reference line label is specified, 
the intersecting vertical axis reference line is labeled with the vertical axis value.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS=’label1’ ...’labeln’] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option.
Specifies the vertical position of labels for HREF= lines.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.
Requests iteration history for the Turnbull algorithm.
Requests a border around probability plots.

[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for text inside framed areas.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies height of text inside framed areas.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance between tiles.

[Syntax: LAXIS=value1 to value2<by value3>] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the lifetime axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, 
and value1 must be less than value2.

[Syntax: LFIT=linetype | (linetype list))] 
          
Specifies a line style for fitted curves and confidence limits. By default, fitted curves are drawn 
by connecting solid lines (linetype = 1), and confidence limits are drawn by connecting dashed lines 
(linetype = 3).

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies a line style for all grid lines; linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

[Syntax: LHREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: LIFELOWER | LLOWER=number] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LLOWER option specifies number as the 
lower lifetime axis tick mark.

[Syntax: LIFEUPPER | LUPPER=number] 
          
Specifies the upper limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LUPPER option specifies number as the 
upper lifetime axis tick mark.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution percentiles.

[Syntax: LOCATION=number < LINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXIT=n] 
          
Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: MAXITEM=number1 <,number2>] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed for the Turnbull algorithm. Iteration history 
will be displayed in increments of n2 if requested with the ITPRINTEM option.

Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, in graphics catalog.

Specifies number of rows plotted on a page.
Specifies sort order for values of the classification variables in the effect-list.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order   depends on your operating environment.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests overlaid plots for group variables.
Plots confidence intervals on probabilities for readout data.

[Syntax: PCTLIST=value-list] 
          
Specifies the list of percentages for which to compute percentile estimates; value-list must be a list 
of values separated by blanks or commas. Each value in the list must be between 0 and 100.

[Syntax: PCTLOWER=value] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the probability axis scale. The PLOWER= option specifies value as the 
lower probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit 
are determined automatically.

[Syntax: PUPPER=value] 
          
Specifies the upper limit on the probability axis scale. The PUPPER= option specifies value as 
the upper probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit
are determined automatically.
Type of parametric pointwise confidence interval displayed in a probability plot.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the percentiles of the fitted CDF
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the cumulative failure probabilities

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PPLEGEND= legend-statement-name | NONE] 
          
Identifies LEGENDn statement to specify legend for overlaid probability plots.
Specifies the plotting position type.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Median ranks

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PPOSSYMBOL=symbol | (symbol list)] 
          
Symbols representing failures on a probability plot.
Specifies that a table of the cumulative probabilities plotted on the probability plot be displayed.

[Syntax: PROBLIST=value-list] 
          
Specifies the list of initial values for the Turnbull algorithm
Prints intervals and associated probabilities for the Turnbull algorithm.

[Syntax: PSTABLE=number] 
          
Specifies stable parameterization. The number must be between zero and one.

[Syntax: PPOSCOLOR=color | (color list)] 
          
Colors of symbols representing failures on a probability plot.

Analyzes data in readout structure. The FREQ statement must be used to specify the number of units 
failing in each interval, and the NENTER statement must be used to specify the number of unfailed 
units entering each interval.
Requests probability plots with probability scale on the horizontal axis.

[Syntax: SCALE=number < SCINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of scale parameter.

[Syntax: SHAPE=number < SHINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of shape parameter.
Display the count for multiple overlaying symbols.

[Syntax: SINGULAR=number] 
          
Specifies singularity criterion for matrix inversion.

[Syntax: SURVTIME=number-list] 
          
Requests that the survival function, cumulative distribution function, and confidence limits 
be computed for values in number-list

[Syntax: THRESHOLD=number] 
          
Specifies a fixed threshold parameter.

[Syntax: TOLLIKE=number] 
          
Specifies criterion for convergence in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁸.

[Syntax: TOLPROB=number] 
          
Specifies criterion for setting interval probability to zero in the Turnbull algorithm. Default is 10⁻⁶.
Vertically strings out characters in labels for vertical axis.

[Syntax: VOFFSET=value] 
          
Length of offset at upper end of vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREF <(INTERSECT)>=value-list] 
          
Requests reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis.

[Syntax: VREFLABELS=’label1’ ...’labeln’] 
          

Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal 
the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can be up to 16 characters.
Specifies the horizontal position of labels for VREF= lines.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: WAXIS=n] 
          
Specifies line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: WFIT=linetype] 
          
Line width for fit line and confidence curves.

[Syntax: WGRID=n] 
          
Specifies line thickness for grids. The default value is 1.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: NENTER variable ;
      
Use the NENTER statement in conjunction with the FREQ statement to specify interval-censored data 
having a special structure; these data are called readout data. The NENTER statement specifies a 
variable in the input data set that determines the number of unfailed units entering each interval.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CAXIS=color] 
          
Specifies the color used for the axes and tick marks. This option overrides any COLOR= specifications 
in an AXIS statement. The default is the first color in the device color list.

Syntax: CCENSOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color for filling the censor plot area. The default is the first color in the device color list.
Plots censored data as frequency counts (rounding for noninteger frequency) rather than as individual points.

[Syntax: CENCOLOR=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the censor symbol. The default is the first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CENSYMBOL=symbol | (symbol list) ] 
          
Specifies symbols for censored values. The symbol is one of the symbol names (plus, star, square, 
diamond, triangle, hash, paw, point, dot, and circle) or a letter (A–Z).

[Syntax: CFIT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the fitted probability line and confidence curves. The default is the 
first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CFRAME=color] 
          
Specifies the color for the area enclosed by the axes and frame. This area is not shaded by default.

[Syntax: CFRAMESIDE=color] 
          
Color for filling frame for row labels.

[Syntax: CFRAMETOP=color] 
          
Color for filling frame for column labels.

[Syntax: CGRID=color] 
          
Specifies the color for grid lines. The default is the first color in the device color list.

[Syntax: CHREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is the first color in the 
device color list.

[Syntax: CONFIDENCE=number] 
          
Specifies the confidence coefficient for all confidence intervals. Specify a number between 0 and 1. 
The default value is 0.95.

[Syntax: CONVERGE=value] 
          
Sets the convergence criterion for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: CONVH=number] 
          
Specifies the convergence criterion for the relative Hessian convergence criterion.
Requests parameter correlation matrix.
Requests parameter covariance matrix.

[Syntax: CTEXT=color] 
          
Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified 
for the CTEXT= option in the most recent GOPTIONS statement.

[Syntax: CVREF=color] 
          
Specifies the color for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is the first color in the 
device color list.

[Syntax: DESCRIPTION=’string’] 
          
Description for graphics catalog member.
Specifies method of estimating distribution parameters.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The probability axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Least squares fit to the probability plot. The lifetime axis is the dependent variable.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Uses the fit from the preceding MODEL statement.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip6: Weibayes method, where number is the confidence coefficient for the Weibayes fit and is between 0 and 1.  The default value is 0.95.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis 
labels in an AXIS statement.
Computes and draws confidence limits for the predicted probabilities in the horizontal direction.

[Syntax: HEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies the height of text used outside framed areas. The default value is 3.846 (in percentage).

[Syntax: HLOWER=value] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The HLOWER= option specifies value as the lower 
lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HOFFSET=value] 
          
Specifies the offset for the horizontal axis. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: HUPPER=value] 
          
Specifies value as the upper lifetime axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and 
the lower axis limit are determined automatically.

[Syntax: HREF <(INTERSECT)> =value-list] 
          
Requests reference lines perpendicular to horizontal axis. If (INTERSECT) is specified, a second 
reference line perpendicular to the vertical axis is drawn that intersects the fit line at the same 
point as the horizontal axis reference line. If a horizontal axis reference line label is specified, 
the intersecting vertical axis reference line is labeled with the vertical axis value.

[Syntax: HREFLABELS=’label1’ ...’labeln’] 
          
Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option.
Specifies the vertical position of labels for HREF= lines.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Staggered from top

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Requests iteration history for maximum likelihood fit.
Requests a border around probability plots.

[Syntax: INFONT=font] 
          
Specifies a software font for text inside framed areas.

[Syntax: INHEIGHT=value] 
          
Specifies height of text inside framed areas.

[Syntax: INTERTILE=value] 
          
Specifies the distance between tiles.
Displays the iteration history for the Turnbull algorithm.

[Syntax: LAXIS=value1 to value2<by value3>] 
          
Specifies tick mark values for the lifetime axis. value1, value2, and value3 must be numeric, 
and value1 must be less than value2.

[Syntax: LFIT=linetype | (linetype list))] 
          
Specifies a line style for fitted curves and confidence limits. By default, fitted curves are drawn 
by connecting solid lines (linetype = 1), and confidence limits are drawn by connecting dashed lines 
(linetype = 3).

[Syntax: LGRID=linetype] 
          
Specifies a line style for all grid lines; linetype is between 1 and 46. The default is 35.

[Syntax: LHREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the HREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: LIFELOWER | LLOWER=number] 
          
Specifies the lower limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LLOWER option specifies number as the 
lower lifetime axis tick mark.

[Syntax: LIFEUPPER | LUPPER=number] 
          
Specifies the upper limit on the lifetime axis scale. The LUPPER option specifies number as the 
upper lifetime axis tick mark.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution parameters.
Requests likelihood ratio confidence intervals for distribution percentiles.

[Syntax: LOCATION=number < LINIT >] 
          
Specifies fixed or initial value of the location, or intercept parameter.

[Syntax: LVREF=linetype] 
          
Specifies the line type for lines requested by the VREF= option. The default is 2, which produces 
a dashed line.

[Syntax: MAXIT=n] 
          
Specifies maximum number of iterations allowed for maximum likelihood fit.

[Syntax: MAXITEM=number1 <,number2>] 
          
Specifies the maximum number of iterations allowed for the Turnbull algorithm. Iteration history 
will be displayed in increments of n2 if requested with the ITPRINTEM option.
Requests that missing values of first GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.
Requests that missing values of second GROUP= variable be treated as a level of the variable.

[Syntax: NCOLS=n] 
          
Specifies number of columns plotted on a page.

[Syntax: NAME=’string’] 
          
Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters, in graphics catalog.
Suppresses the plotting of censored data points.
Suppresses the default percentile confidence bands on the probability plot.
Suppresses the fitted probability (percentile) line and confidence bands.
Suppresses the frame around plotting areas.
Suppresses grid lines.
Suppresses inset.
Suppresses computation of percentiles for standard list of percentage points.
Suppresses setting small interval probabilities to zero in the Turnbull algorithm.
Specifies type of nonparametric confidence interval displayed in a probability plot.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Pointwise confidence intervals for the CDF
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Simultaneous confidence intervals for the CDF

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata: Suppresses legend for overlaid probability plots.
Suppresses plotting of symbols for failures in a probability plot.

[Syntax: NROWS=n] 
          
Specifies number of rows plotted on a page.
Specifies sort order for values of the classification variables in the effect-list.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Orders values according to their order in the input data set.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Orders values by their ascending formatted values. This order depends on your operating environment.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Orders values by descending frequency count so that levels with the most observations are listed first.
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip4: Orders values by their unformatted values, which yields the same order as PROC SORT. This order  depends on your operating environment.

Plots confidence intervals on probabilities for readout data.

lower probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the upper axis limit 
are determined automatically.

[Syntax: PUPPER=value] 
          
Specifies the upper limit on the probability axis scale. The PUPPER= option specifies value as the 
upper probability axis tick mark. The tick mark interval and the lower axis limit are determined 
automatically.
Type of parametric pointwise confidence interval displayed in a probability plot.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the percentiles of the fitted CDF
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Pointwise parametric confidence intervals for the cumulative failure probabilities

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Right

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:

Specifies line thickness for axes and frame. The default value is 1.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: UNITID variable; 

The UNITID statement names a variable in the input data set that is used to identify each individual uni
t in an MCFPLOT statement. The value of the UNITID variable for an observation corresponds to the name of
the unit in the study for which a repair or end of history has occurred.
